messages: b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:10): hi! is this the correct way to encode a duration according to hAudio: <abbr class="duration" title="PT1H30M">90 min</abbr> ?
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (18:12): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* duration */ changed the reference from hCalender to hAudio" (+270) http://is.gd/1jcDz
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (18:18): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* duration */ " (-1) http://is.gd/1jcRm
5832a673ae3016d62e5f4af031067e74 (18:22): Though PT90M is also acceptable.
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:23): oh, that's great!

5832a673ae3016d62e5f4af031067e74 (18:24): ISO 8601explicitly allows duration units to "overflow", and I don't think anyone's made an attempt at creating a subset of it such that each duration has a single canonical representation.
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:25): you know so much... :-)
5832a673ae3016d62e5f4af031067e74 (18:25): I wrote an ISO 8601 parser for Swignition. There's probably bugs in it, but it mostly works.
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:26): i wonder what made me reuse "type" and "value" from hCard for hRecipe. hCard is such a mess...
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:27): b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 - what aspects of hCard do you find "a mess"?

b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:28): hrecipe says: "The element MAY include the fields value and type following the conventions outlined in hCard." now i'm struggling to find those conventions...
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:29): http://microformats.org/wiki/hcard#Value_excerpting
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:29): and http://microformats.org/wiki/hcard#type_subproperty_values
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:29): both found by search the hCard TOC for "value" and "type" respectively
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:30): Certainly let me know if you have suggestions for better findability.
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:31): yes, i found it by search too. but first i tried browsing the page, then i tried the TOC, then the element list
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:31): it would be nice to have a description for everey element, ordered by element name, with all the appropriate (non-trivial) information about each element
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:32): like e.g. hRecipe :-)
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:32): by "element" you mean "property" right?
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:32): like hReview :) http://microformats.org/wiki/hreview#Format
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:34): microformats spec conventions definitely evolved with subsequent specs, in particular with specs that introduced new vocabulary (e.g. hReview)

b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:35): i just imagined a poor idealistic user trying to follow all the links i carelessly added for best practices. i'm trying to inline the appropriate parts now and just realized how hard that is

8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (18:44): Tantek edited to-do "hCard 1.0.1 property descriptions, include any non-trivial details, next step, draft hCard 1.0.1 from hCard 1.0, incorporating resolved issues, similarly for hCalendar" (+905) http://is.gd/1je1W
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:45): Thanks b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894, I've added this asnt: pecific to-do item for hCard 1.0.1 so that it is not forgotten.
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:45): you're welcome ;-)

b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:46): native speakers, please: does the following make sense: "The element {{must}} follow the conventions outlined in [[hCard]]. Using only text will fulfill these requirements just fine." ?
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:47): b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 - the convention for "element" vs. "property" is that "element" is used *only* for HTML elements, e.g. <a>, <span>, <div>
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:47): whereas microformats use "property"
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:47): I hope that helps
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:48): ah... okay. but i meant the second sentence
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:48): (btw: hReview uses "field")
5832a673ae3016d62e5f4af031067e74 (18:49): possibly - "Using only text will fulfill these requirements just fine." -> "Plain text fulfils these requirements."

3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:50): b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 - yes that's a good point, no need to use a second term there in hReview - and I can very much respect that use of a second term may add confusion to non-native speakers

b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:51): i'm looking for a phrase with the connotation: "in most cases you won't need anything more than plain text and therefor you don't have to bother with that messy hCard spec. just use plain text only, right?!"
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (18:53): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* fn */ modified reference to hCard" (+40) http://is.gd/1jesW
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:54): b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894, unless otherwise specified, a property is just text.
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:55): e.g. - again, take a look at hReview
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:56): but a little note may safe the innocent goodintentioned implementor a painful search.... it's just a convenience :-)

3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:57): b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 - I disagree - stating "fulfils these requirements" over and over will add clutter and crowd out the key information which is just "text"
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (18:57): it's not convenience - it actually adds "mess" as you put it
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (18:58): maybe you're right. but let me try first

8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (19:06): Tantek edited hreview "replace use of "field" by "property" when the spec means property, reduce confusion by reducing the number of terms that are used to mean the same thing, remove a note which contradicted scope" (-32) http://is.gd/1jeX0

3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:07): b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 - per your point, I've removed the unnecessary use of the term "field" from hReview, and used the term "property" consistently - I would appreciate it if you could check it as a non-native en-speaker to see if that helps. http://microformats.org/wiki/hreview
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (19:07): i'm just doing the same for hRecipe
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (19:09): ThomasLoertsch edited hreview "/* property details */ typo" (+0) http://is.gd/1jf6z
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (19:10): tantek: looks good to me

8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (19:13): Tantek edited hreview "move design principles just before References - most readers will not need to re-analyze how it was designed, and listing the properties sooner helps spec readability." (+172) http://is.gd/1jfhM
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (19:15): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "changed "element" and "field" to "property" (where appropriate)" (+96) http://is.gd/1jfms

8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (19:16): Tantek edited hreview "remove explicit TOC (auto-placement works fine), moved acknowledgments to end near references to move property list to sooner in the document" (-11) http://is.gd/1jfqa
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (19:17): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* ingredient */ arg" (+2) http://is.gd/1jfqQ
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (19:25): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* photo */ removed superfluous link to hCard" (-34) http://is.gd/1jfLP
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (19:29): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* summary */ added: Plain text fulfills these requirements." (+40) http://is.gd/1jfSg

b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (19:34): 5832a673ae3016d62e5f4af031067e74, tantek: does the following make sense and is correct???  "* The contents of the element {{may}} be a plain text string which any conforming parser should interpret as "vcard fn". Anything more elaborate  {{must}} follow the conventions outlined in [[hAtom]].
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (19:35): (about "author")
5832a673ae3016d62e5f4af031067e74 (19:35): Seems sensible to me.
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (19:37): great! thanks
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (19:39): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* author */ added default type "vcard fn"" (+117) http://is.gd/1jgim
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:44): b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 - the author conventions in hAtom have some issues right now, e.g. with improper use of the HTML <address> element
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:44): (yes this has been captured in hatom-issues )
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (19:44): aha. any better idea?
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:45): using the term "author" is good in this case for vocabulary reuse
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:45): however, we should avoid propagating a known issue from hAtom
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (19:46): what if i link to hCard directly?
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:46): yes that would be better

3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:47): better to define it as either a text string meaning the author's name, or a nested hCard providing the author's name (as fn) and any other details (such as URL)
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:47): also - I recommend omitting any text about "conforming parser" from the property definitions.
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:47): the property definitions should be written for authors/publishers
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:48): for parsers/programmers - it is better to create a separate "Parsing" section later
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:48): that specifies any parsing details
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:49): (btw re: "author", hReview's "reviewer" needs similar fixes as well) http://microformats.org/wiki/hreview#Property_details
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (19:49): but they should know *why* they can omit *what*. and therfor they have to know about parsers. but i'll try to make it sound less frightening
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:50): b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 - authors/publishers really don't want to know about parsers
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:50): it's just confusing
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:50): for them - it is just extra text that they have to wade through
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:50): better to group the parsing details in a separate section

8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (20:00): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* published */ deleted reference to hAtom. refering to datetime-design-pattern is good enough and easier to comprehend" (+40) http://is.gd/1jhfL

b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (20:02): tantek: how about this: "* The contents of the element {{may}} be a plain text string in which case it defaults to a "vcard fn". Anything more elaborate  {{must}} follow the conventions outlined in [[hCard]]. "
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (20:04): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* author */ switched from hAtom to hCard, removed parsing note" (-17) http://is.gd/1jhso
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (20:07): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* Property details */ "author" is now inherited from vCard" (-3) http://is.gd/1jhBJ
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (20:08): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* Property details */ " (+2) http://is.gd/1jhEO
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (20:11): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* Parser Processing Notes */ author defaults to "vcard fn"" (+93) http://is.gd/1jhNk
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (20:18): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "/* ingredient */ added example for type and value" (+105) http://is.gd/1ji9J
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (20:23): ThomasLoertsch edited hrecipe "added some spacing between chapters" (+4) http://is.gd/1jinN
0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea (20:38): Good morning, all! Does anyone know if/how Google looks at VoteLinks?
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:41): welcome 0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea!
0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea (20:41): thanks, tantek :-)
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:41): hi 132ea029b178e3c6d3a3aa4521ea24a5. 0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea has a question about Google and VoteLinks.
0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea (20:41): hiya, kevin!
132ea029b178e3c6d3a3aa4521ea24a5 (20:42): whats the question?
0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea (20:42): Does Google give any credence to VoteLinks?
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (20:43): Tantek edited hrecipe "/* Copyright */ fix typo, reference microformats wiki copyrights explicitly" (+6) http://is.gd/1jjjw
132ea029b178e3c6d3a3aa4521ea24a5 (20:43): not that I know of - Pagerank can't handle negative links
0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea (20:43): hmmm...
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:43): but does Google treat "vote-against" like "rel-nofollow" ?
132ea029b178e3c6d3a3aa4521ea24a5 (20:43): google treats normal links as +1 vote and nofollow ones as 0 vote
0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea (20:44): noindex and nofollow seem like such a nuclear option. i'd like to be able to qualify a link and not hide things from spiders.
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:44): then does Google treat "vote-abstain" as 0 vote also?
132ea029b178e3c6d3a3aa4521ea24a5 (20:44): not sure - matt cutts would know
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:44): nofollow is a poorly named rel
132ea029b178e3c6d3a3aa4521ea24a5 (20:44): I don't think so
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:44): it doesn't actually mean "don't follow"
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:44): it just means, don't give any weight to this link
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:45): so crawlers may still spider through "rel-nofollow" links
0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea (20:45): ah
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (20:45): tantek: I talked to maciej yesterday; he's amenable to crediting the microformats principles in the html design principles document.
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (20:45): I'll let you know when that change goes in, if I notice it. Or you can follow along here: http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/html5/html-design-principles/
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:45): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98, very much appreciated
0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea (20:46): that makes a bit of difference, but having a trinary option like votelinks feels like a better solution.
132ea029b178e3c6d3a3aa4521ea24a5 (20:47): yes, that was the original idea
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:47): btw - regarding the naming issue of rel-nofollow: http://microformats.org/wiki/rel-nofollow#open_issues
0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea (20:48): that's exactly what i was looking for, tantek. thanks!
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:48): which reminds me - 132ea029b178e3c6d3a3aa4521ea24a5, mind adding yourself to: http://microformats.org/wiki/rel-nofollow#Copyright
132ea029b178e3c6d3a3aa4521ea24a5 (20:49): oops, sorry, thought i had
8720b1bb098a8f70d156b9fc2028d7db (20:49): Kevin Marks edited rel-nofollow "/* Copyright */ make mine PD" (+164) http://is.gd/1jjCK
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:50): naming is a difficult thing - it's not uncommon for naming errors to occur in formats/specs
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (20:50): 0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea - for more on naming, see http://microformats.org/wiki/naming-principles
0ab24a9a3d2112cca1aa4cb2cf262fea (20:51): thanks, kevin!
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (21:04): There are only two hard things in Computer Science: cache invalidation and naming things. -- Phil Karlton
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (21:12): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 - do you have a citation for that quote?
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (21:18): there is no wikipedia page for Phil Karlton nor is there any mention in Wikiquote: http://en.wikiquote.org/wiki/Special:Search/Phil_Karlton
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (21:18): also, I think Knuth would beg to differ that "there are only two hard things in Computer Science".
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (21:37): b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 I made a small fix/update to the copyright section in hRecipe - looks like there may have been a copy/paste typo from hAudio
b5d30d87d3e4dab71d8ff14065384894 (21:38): tantek: thanks. that's very well possible. i found more than one months after editing it ...

3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (21:51): sf folks - since we just had the 4th bday party last Friday - none of us usual organizers has proposed a dinner for tonight (yet). if there is interest however, we can certainly make it happen.
